content: The Act titled "Make College Affordable Act of 2003" expands the deduction for higher education expenses. The "Make College Affordable Act of 2003" expands the deduction for higher education expenses under section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Make College Affordable Act of 2003" increases the deduction for higher education expenses under section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code. The deduction limits for qualified tuition and related expenses are set at $8,000 for 2003 and $12,000 for 2004 onwards, with reductions based on modified adjusted gross income. The amendments made by this section apply to any qualified education loan incurred before or after the enactment of this Act, with respect to loan interest payment due after December 31, 2002.
